title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 December 2012 - XWiki

09:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <LMolr> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <LMolr> Hello. Is it possible to install XWiki on a shared hosting which doesn't support WAR deployment? I have such a plan, with a shared JVM and Tomcat.  
09:53 <vmassol> LMolr: if you have tomcat then it supports WAR deployments  
09:54 <LMolr> vmassol, unfortunately, my hosting provider doesn't allow me to do so. I think it's an anti-feature for marketing purpose.  
09:55 <vmassol> how do you deploy?  
09:55 <vmassol> servlet containers only support WARs AFAIK  
09:55 <vmassol> (at least I have never deployed in any other way)  
09:56 <LMolr> vmassol, I am noob in this field. Is it possible they only support jsps? does it make sense?  
09:56 <vmassol> nope  
09:56 <vmassol> doesn't make sense  
09:56 <vmassol> the two are completely different  
09:56 <vmassol> one is a deployment foramt  
09:57 <vmassol> the other is a type of file  
09:57 <vmassol> you still need to deploy that file  
09:58 <LMolr> vmassol, ok. so I need to ask further for the war deployment. I hope next support guy will be better than the previous one. Thank you vmassol !  
09:58 <vmassol> gl  
09:59 <vmassol> if you need a hoster, also consider usign xwiki cloud or xwiki sas hosting (http://xwiki.com)  
10:05 <LMolr> vmassol, ok. The support guy is telling me this: "Ian: Your current plan can have shared JVM where you can host only JSP pages ."  
10:36 <vmassol> has quit
